page.title: 01Arcleoch Forest South West
page.content: This is the original or oldest part of the forest. The trees planted date from 1958 to 1970. This area also contains the highest land thoughout the whole forest and is planted mainly with Sitka Spruce imported from Queen Charlotte Islands Western America. Arecleoch House original and new stands within the forest arera and the forest is named after the old Arecleoch Farm and estate. The ground which is not afforested is rough open hill grazing belonging to Chirmorie Farm lying SE from Arecleoch House. This area is also disected by the main Glasgow-Stranraer Railway line. The whole area could be classed as glacial upland moor the main soil type being peaty gley. This makes the tree crop very unstable due to wind.
